<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>One of the things we could look at is the age of the twitter accounts, how old they are and when they were created. This could give us a better understanding about the accounts of users who tweet about either candidate. A candidiate having more user accounts created recently might imply some kind of manipulation owing to fake Twitter accounts.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [5]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># create new column called user_age from data in created and user_created column</span>
<span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">datetime</span> <span class="k">import</span> <span class="n">datetime</span>
<span class="n">tweets</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"created"</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">to_datetime</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">tweets</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"created"</span><span class="p">])</span>
<span class="n">tweets</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"user_created"</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">to_datetime</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">tweets</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"user_created"</span><span class="p">])</span>
<span class="n">tweets</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"user_age"</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">tweets</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"user_created"</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">apply</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="k">lambda</span> <span class="n">x</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">datetime</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">now</span><span class="p">()</span> <span class="o">-</span> <span class="n">x</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">total_seconds</span><span class="p">()</span> <span class="o">/</span> <span class="mi">3600</span> <span class="o">/</span> <span class="mi">24</span> <span class="o">/</span> <span class="mi">365</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">cl_tweets</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">tweets</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"user_age"</span><span class="p">][</span><span class="n">tweets</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"candidate"</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">==</span><span class="s2">"clinton"</span><span class="p">]</span>
<span class="n">tr_tweets</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">tweets</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"user_age"</span><span class="p">][</span><span class="n">tweets</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"candidate"</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">==</span><span class="s2">"trump"</span><span class="p">]</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>This also gives us an opportunity to extract out the number of tweets made for each candidate by those accounts. Let's look at these two together.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [ ]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1">#plotting number of tweets mentioning each candidate combination</span>
<span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">plotly</span> 
<span class="n">plotly</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">tools</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">set_credentials_file</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">username</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'**********'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">api_key</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'**********'</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">plotly.plotly</span> <span class="k">as</span> <span class="nn">py</span>
<span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">plotly.graph_objs</span> <span class="k">import</span> <span class="o">*</span>

<span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">plotly.graph_objs</span> <span class="k">as</span> <span class="nn">go</span>

<span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">numpy</span> <span class="k">as</span> <span class="nn">np</span>
<span class="n">x0</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">cl_tweets</span>
<span class="n">x1</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">tr_tweets</span>

<span class="n">trace1</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">go</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">Histogram</span><span class="p">(</span>
    <span class="n">x</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">x0</span><span class="p">,</span>
    <span class="n">histnorm</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'count'</span><span class="p">,</span>
    <span class="n">name</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'Clinton'</span><span class="p">,</span>
    

    <span class="n">marker</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="nb">dict</span><span class="p">(</span>
        <span class="n">color</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'blue'</span><span class="p">,</span>
        <span class="n">line</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="nb">dict</span><span class="p">(</span>
            <span class="n">color</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'blue'</span><span class="p">,</span>
            <span class="n">width</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">0</span>
        <span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="p">),</span>
    <span class="n">opacity</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mf">0.75</span>
<span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">trace2</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">go</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">Histogram</span><span class="p">(</span>
    <span class="n">x</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">x1</span><span class="p">,</span>
    <span class="n">name</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'Trump'</span><span class="p">,</span>
    

    <span class="n">marker</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="nb">dict</span><span class="p">(</span>
        <span class="n">color</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'red'</span>
    <span class="p">),</span>
    <span class="n">opacity</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mf">0.75</span>
<span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">data</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="n">trace1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">trace2</span><span class="p">]</span>
<span class="n">layout</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">go</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">Layout</span><span class="p">(</span>
    <span class="n">title</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'Tweets mentioning each candidate'</span><span class="p">,</span>
    <span class="n">xaxis</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="nb">dict</span><span class="p">(</span>
        <span class="n">title</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'Twitter account age in years'</span>
    <span class="p">),</span>
    <span class="n">yaxis</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="nb">dict</span><span class="p">(</span>
        <span class="n">title</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'Number of tweets'</span>
    <span class="p">),</span>
    <span class="n">barmode</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'stack'</span><span class="p">,</span>
    <span class="n">bargap</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mf">0.2</span><span class="p">,</span>
    <span class="n">bargroupgap</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mf">0.1</span>
<span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">fig</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">go</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">Figure</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">data</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">data</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">layout</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">layout</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">py</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">iplot</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">fig</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">filename</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'number-of-tweets'</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<div>
<a href="https://plot.ly/~guneetkohli89/94/" style="display: block; text-align: center;" target="_blank" title="Tweets mentioning each candidate"><img alt="Tweets mentioning each candidate" onerror="this.onerror=null;this.src='https://plot.ly/404.png';" src="https://plot.ly/~guneetkohli89/94.png" style="max-width: 100%;width: 600px;" width="600" /></a>
<script async="" data-plotly="guneetkohli89:94" src="https://plot.ly/embed.js"></script>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>We can take a step further and breakdown the data by the state from which the Tweets are coming from. This would give us an idea about how the this tweet traffic is spread across different states.  Let's see how this geographic layout is for Hillary Clinton.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [ ]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1">#Visualize tweets by location for Hillary Clinton.</span>

<span class="n">scl</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[[</span><span class="mf">0.0</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'rgb(170,170,255)'</span><span class="p">],[</span><span class="mf">0.2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'rgb(130,130,255)'</span><span class="p">],[</span><span class="mf">0.4</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'rgb(120,120,255)'</span><span class="p">],</span>\
            <span class="p">[</span><span class="mf">0.6</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'rgb(100,100,255)'</span><span class="p">],[</span><span class="mf">0.8</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'rgb(50,50,255)'</span><span class="p">],[</span><span class="mf">1.0</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'rgb(0,0,255)'</span><span class="p">]]</span>

<span class="n">data</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span> <span class="nb">dict</span><span class="p">(</span>
        <span class="nb">type</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'choropleth'</span><span class="p">,</span>
        <span class="n">colorscale</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">scl</span><span class="p">,</span>
        <span class="n">autocolorscale</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">False</span><span class="p">,</span>
        <span class="n">locations</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">clcount</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">index</span><span class="p">,</span> 
        <span class="n">z</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">clcount</span><span class="p">,</span>
        <span class="n">locationmode</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'USA-states'</span><span class="p">,</span>
        <span class="n">text</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s2">"Tweets about Cliton"</span><span class="p">,</span>
        <span class="n">marker</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">dict</span><span class="p">(</span>
            <span class="n">line</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">dict</span> <span class="p">(</span>
                <span class="n">color</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'rgb(255,255,255)'</span><span class="p">,</span>
                <span class="n">width</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">2</span>
            <span class="p">)</span> <span class="p">),</span>
        <span class="n">colorbar</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">dict</span><span class="p">(</span>
            <span class="n">title</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s2">"Location by the numbers"</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="p">)</span> <span class="p">]</span>

<span class="n">layout</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">dict</span><span class="p">(</span>
        <span class="n">title</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'Who is talking about Hillary Clinton?'</span><span class="p">,</span>
        <span class="n">geo</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">dict</span><span class="p">(</span>
            <span class="n">scope</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'usa'</span><span class="p">,</span>
            <span class="n">projection</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="nb">dict</span><span class="p">(</span> <span class="nb">type</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'albers usa'</span> <span class="p">)</span>
             <span class="p">))</span>
    
<span class="n">fig</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">dict</span><span class="p">(</span> <span class="n">data</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">data</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">layout</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">layout</span> <span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">py</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">iplot</span><span class="p">(</span> <span class="n">fig</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">filename</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'d3-cloropleth-map'</span> <span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<div>
<a href="https://plot.ly/~guneetkohli89/102/" style="display: block; text-align: center;" target="_blank" title="Who is talking about Hillary Clinton?"><img alt="Who is talking about Hillary Clinton?" onerror="this.onerror=null;this.src='https://plot.ly/404.png';" src="https://plot.ly/~guneetkohli89/102.png" style="max-width: 100%;width: 600px;" width="600" /></a>
<script async="" data-plotly="guneetkohli89:102" src="https://plot.ly/embed.js"></script>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>And now let's do the same for Donald Trump.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [ ]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># Visualize tweets by location for Donald Trump. </span>

<span class="n">scl</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[[</span><span class="mf">0.0</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'rgb(255,170,170)'</span><span class="p">],[</span><span class="mf">0.2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'rgb(255,130,130)'</span><span class="p">],[</span><span class="mf">0.4</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'rgb(255,120,120)'</span><span class="p">],</span>\
            <span class="p">[</span><span class="mf">0.6</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'rgb(255,100,100)'</span><span class="p">],[</span><span class="mf">0.8</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'rgb(255,50,50)'</span><span class="p">],[</span><span class="mf">1.0</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'rgb(255,0,0)'</span><span class="p">]]</span>

<span class="n">data</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span> <span class="nb">dict</span><span class="p">(</span>
        <span class="nb">type</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'choropleth'</span><span class="p">,</span>
        <span class="n">colorscale</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">scl</span><span class="p">,</span>
        <span class="n">autocolorscale</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">False</span><span class="p">,</span>
        <span class="n">locations</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">trcount</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">index</span><span class="p">,</span> 
        <span class="n">z</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">trcount</span><span class="p">,</span>
        <span class="n">locationmode</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'USA-states'</span><span class="p">,</span>
        <span class="n">text</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s2">"Tweets about Trump"</span><span class="p">,</span>
        <span class="n">marker</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">dict</span><span class="p">(</span>
            <span class="n">line</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">dict</span> <span class="p">(</span>
                <span class="n">color</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'rgb(255,255,255)'</span><span class="p">,</span>
                <span class="n">width</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">2</span>
            <span class="p">)</span> <span class="p">),</span>
        <span class="n">colorbar</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">dict</span><span class="p">(</span>
            <span class="n">title</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s2">"Tweet Locations"</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="p">)</span> <span class="p">]</span>

<span class="n">layout</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">dict</span><span class="p">(</span>
        <span class="n">title</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'Who is talking about Donald Trump?'</span><span class="p">,</span>
        <span class="n">geo</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">dict</span><span class="p">(</span>
            <span class="n">scope</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'usa'</span><span class="p">,</span>
            <span class="n">projection</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="nb">dict</span><span class="p">(</span> <span class="nb">type</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'albers usa'</span> <span class="p">)</span>
             <span class="p">))</span>
    
<span class="n">fig</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">dict</span><span class="p">(</span> <span class="n">data</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">data</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">layout</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">layout</span> <span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">py</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">iplot</span><span class="p">(</span> <span class="n">fig</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">filename</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'d3-cloropleth-map'</span> <span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<div>
<a href="https://plot.ly/~guneetkohli89/104/" style="display: block; text-align: center;" target="_blank" title="Who is talking about Donald Trump?"><img alt="Who is talking about Donald Trump?" onerror="this.onerror=null;this.src='https://plot.ly/404.png';" src="https://plot.ly/~guneetkohli89/104.png" style="max-width: 100%;width: 600px;" width="600" /></a>
<script async="" data-plotly="guneetkohli89:104" src="https://plot.ly/embed.js"></script>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>And now we can put the data behind the above two visualisations together and see who gets more traffic across the country. This gives us some interesting insights about certain as to which candidate they are more vocal about.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [ ]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># Visualize tweet content for Clinton and Trump on state basis</span>

<span class="n">scl</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[[</span><span class="mf">0.0</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'rgb(130,130,255)'</span><span class="p">],[</span><span class="mf">0.2</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'rgb(255,170,170)'</span><span class="p">],[</span><span class="mf">0.4</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'rgb(255,150,150)'</span><span class="p">],</span>\
            <span class="p">[</span><span class="mf">0.6</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'rgb(255,100,100)'</span><span class="p">],[</span><span class="mf">0.8</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'rgb(255,50,50)'</span><span class="p">],[</span><span class="mf">1.0</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'rgb(255,0,0)'</span><span class="p">]]</span>


<span class="n">data</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span> <span class="nb">dict</span><span class="p">(</span>
        <span class="nb">type</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'choropleth'</span><span class="p">,</span>
        <span class="n">colorscale</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">scl</span><span class="p">,</span>
        <span class="n">autocolorscale</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">False</span><span class="p">,</span>
        <span class="n">locations</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">filteredpopularityindex</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">index</span><span class="p">,</span> 
        <span class="n">z</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">filteredpopularityindex</span><span class="p">,</span>
        <span class="n">locationmode</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'USA-states'</span><span class="p">,</span>
        <span class="n">text</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s2">"Trump and Clinton together"</span><span class="p">,</span>
        <span class="n">marker</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">dict</span><span class="p">(</span>
            <span class="n">line</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">dict</span> <span class="p">(</span>
                <span class="n">color</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'rgb(255,255,255)'</span><span class="p">,</span>
                <span class="n">width</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">2</span>
            <span class="p">)</span> <span class="p">),</span>
        <span class="n">colorbar</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">dict</span><span class="p">(</span>
            <span class="n">title</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s2">"Tweet Majority"</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="p">)</span> <span class="p">]</span>

<span class="n">layout</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">dict</span><span class="p">(</span>
        <span class="n">title</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'Who are we really talking about?'</span><span class="p">,</span>
        <span class="n">geo</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">dict</span><span class="p">(</span>
            <span class="n">scope</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'usa'</span><span class="p">,</span>
            <span class="n">projection</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="nb">dict</span><span class="p">(</span> <span class="nb">type</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'albers usa'</span> <span class="p">)</span>
             <span class="p">))</span>
    
<span class="n">fig</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">dict</span><span class="p">(</span> <span class="n">data</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">data</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">layout</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">layout</span> <span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">py</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">iplot</span><span class="p">(</span> <span class="n">fig</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">filename</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'d3-cloropleth-map'</span> <span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<div>
<a href="https://plot.ly/~guneetkohli89/106/" style="display: block; text-align: center;" target="_blank" title="Who are we really talking about?"><img alt="Who are we really talking about?" onerror="this.onerror=null;this.src='https://plot.ly/404.png';" src="https://plot.ly/~guneetkohli89/106.png" style="max-width: 100%;width: 600px;" width="600" /></a>
<script async="" data-plotly="guneetkohli89:106" src="https://plot.ly/embed.js"></script>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Sentiment analysis is an area dedicated to extracting subjective emotions from text. It's the process of learning whether the writer feels positively or negatively about a topic.</p>
<p>We generated sentiment scores for each tweet using TextBlob, which are stored in the polarity column. We can plot the mean value for each candidate, along with the standard deviation. The standard deviation will tell us how wide the variation is between all the tweets, whereas the mean will tell us how the average tweet is.</p>
<p>TextBlob is a Python library for processing textual data. It provides a platform to dive into common natural language processing (NLP) tasks such as part-of-speech tagging, noun phrase extraction, sentiment analysis, and more.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>On the whole, we can see the mean tweet sentiment for each candidate as below.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [ ]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">data</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="n">go</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">Bar</span><span class="p">(</span>
            <span class="n">x</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'clinton'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'trump'</span><span class="p">],</span>
            <span class="n">y</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">mean</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">],</span><span class="n">mean</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">]]</span>
    <span class="p">)]</span>
<span class="n">layout</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">go</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">Layout</span><span class="p">(</span>
    <span class="n">title</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'Mean Tweet Sentiment'</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">fig</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">go</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">Figure</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">data</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">data</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">layout</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">layout</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">py</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">iplot</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">fig</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">filename</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'basic-bar'</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<div>
<a href="https://plot.ly/~guneetkohli89/108/" style="display: block; text-align: center;" target="_blank" title="Mean Tweet Sentiment"><img alt="Mean Tweet Sentiment" onerror="this.onerror=null;this.src='https://plot.ly/404.png';" src="https://plot.ly/~guneetkohli89/108.png" style="max-width: 100%;width: 600px;" width="600" /></a>
<script async="" data-plotly="guneetkohli89:108" src="https://plot.ly/embed.js"></script>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>As we can see, Donald Trump is the more talked about candidate and the mean sentiment for him is higher than for Hillary Clinton (or it was, at the time this sentence was published on 14 August 2016. We plot the standard deviation of the sentiment below which tells how wide the variation between all the tweets is.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [ ]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="n">data</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="n">go</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">Bar</span><span class="p">(</span>
            <span class="n">x</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'clinton'</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="s1">'trump'</span><span class="p">],</span>
            <span class="n">y</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">std</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">],</span><span class="n">std</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">]]</span>
    <span class="p">)]</span>
<span class="n">layout</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">go</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">Layout</span><span class="p">(</span>
    <span class="n">title</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'Standard Deviation of Tweet Sentiment'</span><span class="p">,</span>
<span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">fig</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">go</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">Figure</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">data</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">data</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">layout</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">layout</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">py</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">iplot</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">fig</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">filename</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'basic-bar'</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<div>
<a href="https://plot.ly/~guneetkohli89/110/" style="display: block; text-align: center;" target="_blank" title="Standard Deviation of Tweet Sentiment"><img alt="Standard Deviation of Tweet Sentiment" onerror="this.onerror=null;this.src='https://plot.ly/404.png';" src="https://plot.ly/~guneetkohli89/110.png" style="max-width: 100%;width: 600px;" width="600" /></a>
<script async="" data-plotly="guneetkohli89:110" src="https://plot.ly/embed.js"></script>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2> Next Steps </h2><p>This has been a good start to pique some interest and we can now branch off in a number of directions. Some things we could check out further :</p>
<p><ui></ui></p>
<li> Analyze user descriptions, and see how description length varies by candidate </li>
<li> See what kinds of usernames tweet more about what kinds of candidates </li>
<li> Identify potential swing states by taking into account sentiment across known republican and democratic states </li><p>Keep watching this space as we draw closer to the elections. Twitter activity around the presidential debates should give us some pretty interesting insights.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
